alert.note: Alert for Elko; Humboldt; Lander (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Advisory issued September 20 at 5:39PM PDT until September 20 at 7:15PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: The National Weather Service in Elko Nevada has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Southeastern Humboldt County in northwestern Nevada... Northeastern Lander County in north central Nevada... West central Elko County in northeastern Nevada... * Until 715 PM PDT. * At 538 PM PDT, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 16 miles north of Winnemucca to 13 miles south of Golconda to 22 miles southeast of Unionville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar and satellite. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. Locations impacted include... Winnemucca, Battle Mountain, Golconda, Valmy, Argenta, Midas, Golconda Summit, Phoenix Mine, Midas Mine, Winnemucca Airport, Trenton Canyon Mine, Mule Canyon Reclamation Project, Adam Peak, Lone Tree Mine and Twin Creeks Mine. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
